R6 Interface to Tetrad Search Algorithms — TetradSearch
text: method (character) Name algorithm (e.g., "fges", "pc", "fci", etc.). ... Additional parameters passed private algorithm-setting methods. following algorithms, following parameters available: "boss" - BOSS algorithm. num_starts = 1 - number times algorithm started different initializations. default, algorithm run least using initialized parameters, use_bes = TRUE - TRUE, algorithm uses backward equivalence search GES algorithm one steps, use_data_order = TRUE - TRUE, data variable order used first initial permutation, output_cpdag = TRUE - TRUE, DAG output algorithm converted CPDAG. "boss_fci" - BOSS-FCI algorithm. depth = -1 - Maximum size conditioning set, Set -1 unlimited, max_disc_path_length = -1 - Maximum length discriminating path, Set -1 unlimited, use_bes = TRUE - TRUE, algorithm uses backward equivalence search GES algorithm one steps, use_heuristic = FALSE - TRUE, use max p heuristic version, complete_rule_set_used = TRUE -  FALSE (simpler) final orientation rules set due P. Spirtes, guaranteeing arrow completeness, used; TRUE (fuller) set due J. Zhang, used guaranteeing additional tail completeness, guarantee_pag = FALSE - Ensure output legal PAG (feasible). "fci" - FCI algorithm. depth = -1 - Maximum size conditioning set, stable_fas = TRUE - TRUE, "stable" version PC adjacency search used, k > 0 fixes graph depth k + 1 previous depth k. max_disc_path_length = -1 - Maximum length discriminating path, complete_rule_set_used = TRUE - FALSE (simpler) final orientation rules set due P. Spirtes, guaranteeing arrow completeness, used; TRUE (fuller) set due J. Zhang, used guaranteeing additional tail completeness. guarantee_pag = FALSE - Ensure output legal PAG (feasible). "ges" ("fges") - Fast Greedy Equivalence Search (FGES) algorithm. symmetric_first_step = FALSE - TRUE, scores X –> Y X <– Y calculated higher score used. max_degree = -1 - Maximum degree node graph. Set -1 unlimited, parallelized = FALSE - TRUE, algorithm parallelized, faithfulness_assumed = FALSE - TRUE, assume \(X \perp\!\!\!\perp Y\) (independence test) \(X \perp\!\!\!\perp Y\) | Z nonempty Z. "gfci" - GFCI algorithm. Combines FGES FCI. depth = -1 - Maximum size conditioning set, max_degree = -1 - Maximum degree node graph. Set -1 unlimited, max_disc_path_length = -1 - Maximum length discriminating path, complete_rule_set_used = TRUE - FALSE (simpler) final orientation rules set due P. Spirtes, guaranteeing arrow completeness, used; TRUE (fuller) set due J. Zhang, used guaranteeing additional tail completeness, guarantee_pag = FALSE - Ensure output legal PAG (feasible), use_heuristic = FALSE - TRUE, use max p heuristic. start_complete = FALSE - TRUE, start complete graph. "grasp" - GRaSP (Greedy Relations Sparsest Permutation) algorithm. covered_depth = 4 - depth recursion first search, singular_depth = 1 - Recursion depth singular tucks, nonsingular_depth = 1 - Recursion depth nonsingular tucks, ordered_alg = FALSE - TRUE, earlier GRaSP stages performed later stages, raskutti_uhler = FALSE - TRUE, use Raskutti Uhler's DAG-building method (test); FALSE, use Grow-Shrink (score). use_data_order = TRUE - TRUE, data variable order used first initial permutation, num_starts = 1 - number times algorithm started different initializations. default, algorithm run least using initialized parameters. "grasp_fci" - GRaSP-FCI algorithm. Combines GRaSP FCI. depth = -1 - Maximum size conditioning set, stable_fas = TRUE - TRUE, "stable" version PC adjacency search used, k > 0 fixes graph depth k + 1 previous depth k. max_disc_path_length = -1 - Maximum length discriminating path, complete_rule_set_used = TRUE - FALSE (simpler) final orientation rules set due P. Spirtes, guaranteeing arrow completeness, used; TRUE (fuller) set due J. Zhang, used guaranteeing additional tail completeness, covered_depth = 4 - depth recursion first search, singular_depth = 1 - Recursion depth singular tucks, nonsingular_depth = 1 - Recursion depth nonsingular tucks, ordered_alg = FALSE - TRUE, earlier GRaSP stages performed later stages, raskutti_uhler = FALSE - TRUE, use Raskutti Uhler's DAG-building method (test); FALSE, use Grow-Shrink (score). use_data_order = TRUE - TRUE, data variable order used first initial permutation, num_starts = 1 - number times algorithm started different initializations. default, algorithm run least using initialized parameters, guarantee_pag = FALSE - TRUE, ensure output legal PAG (feasible). "pc" - Peter-Clark (PC) algorithm conflict_rule = 1 - value conflict_rule determines collider conflicts handled. 1 corresponds "overwrite" rule introduced pcalg package, see pcalg::pc(). 2 means collider conflicts using bidirected edges prioritized, 3 means existing colliders prioritized, ignoring subsequent conflicting information. depth = -1 - Maximum size conditioning set, stable_fas = TRUE - TRUE, "stable" version PC adjacency search used, k > 0 fixes graph depth k + 1 previous depth k. guarantee_cpdag = FALSE - TRUE, ensure output legal CPDAG. "rfci" - Restricted FCI algorithm depth = -1 - Maximum size conditioning set, stable_fas = TRUE - TRUE, "stable" version PC adjacency search used, k > 0 fixes graph depth k + 1 previous depth k. max_disc_path_length = -1 - Maximum length discriminating path, complete_rule_set_used = TRUE - FALSE (simpler) final orientation rules set due P. Spirtes, guaranteeing arrow completeness, used; TRUE (fuller) set due J. Zhang, used guaranteeing additional tail completeness. guarantee_pag = FALSE - Ensure output legal PAG (feasible). "sp_fci" - Sparsest Permutation using FCI depth = -1 - Maximum size conditioning set, max_disc_path_length = -1 - Maximum length discriminating path, complete_rule_set_used = TRUE - FALSE (simpler) final orientation rules set due P. Spirtes, guaranteeing arrow completeness, used; TRUE (fuller) set due J. Zhang, used guaranteeing additional tail completeness, guarantee_pag = FALSE - Ensure output legal PAG (feasible), use_heuristic = FALSE - TRUE, use max p heuristic version.

code: ### tetrad_search R6 class examples ###  # Generally, we do not recommend using the R6 classes directly, but rather # use the disco() or any method function, for example pc(), instead.  # Requires Tetrad to be installed if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   data(num_data)    # Recommended:   my_pc <- pc(engine = "tetrad", test = "fisher_z")   my_pc(num_data)    # or   disco(data = num_data, method = my_pc)    # Example with detailed settings:   my_pc2 <- pc(     engine = "tetrad",     test = "sem_bic",     penalty_discount = 1,     structure_prior = 1,     singularity_lambda = 0.1   )   disco(data = num_data, method = my_pc2)    # Using R6 class:   s <- TetradSearch$new()    s$set_data(num_data)   s$set_test(method = "fisher_z", alpha = 0.05)   s$set_alg("pc")    g <- s$run_search()    print(g) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from  edge  to    #>   <chr> <chr> <chr> #> 1 X1    -->   Y     #> 2 X1    ---   Z     #> 3 X2    ---   X3    #> 4 X2    -->   Y     #> 5 X3    -->   Y     #> 6 Z     -->   Y     #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name  #>   <chr> #> 1 X1    #> 2 X2    #> 3 X3    #> 4 Z     #> 5 Y     #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

title: Add Exogenous Variables to Knowledge — add_exogenous
text: Updated knowledge object.

title: Add Exogenous Variables to Knowledge — add_exogenous
code: data(tpc_example)  # create knowledge object using verbs kn1 <- knowledge() |>   add_vars(names(tpc_example)) |>   add_tier(child) |>   add_tier(old, after = child) |>   add_tier(youth, before = old) |>   add_to_tier(child ~ starts_with("child")) |>   add_to_tier(youth ~ starts_with("youth")) |>   add_to_tier(old ~ starts_with("oldage")) |>   require_edge(child_x1 ~ youth_x3) |>   forbid_edge(child_x2 ~ youth_x4) |>   add_exogenous(child_x1) # synonym: add_exo()  # set kn1 to frozen # (meaning you cannot add variables to the knowledge object anymore) # this is to get a true on the identical check kn1$frozen <- TRUE  # create identical knowledge object using DSL kn2 <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     old ~ starts_with("oldage")   ),   child_x1 %-->% youth_x3,   child_x2 %!-->% youth_x4,   exo(child_x1) # synonym: exogenous() )  print(identical(kn1, kn2)) #> [1] TRUE  # cannot require an edge against tier direction try(   kn1 |> require_edge(oldage_x6 ~ child_x1) ) #> Error : Edge(s) violate tier ordering: oldage_x6 --> child_x1  # cannot forbid and require same edge try(   kn1 |> forbid_edge(child_x1 ~ youth_x3) ) #> Error : Edge(s) appear as both forbidden and required: child_x1 --> youth_x3

what: Convert Knowledge to pcalg Knowledge — as_pcalg_constraints
title: Convert Knowledge to pcalg Knowledge — as_pcalg_constraints
text: pcalg supports undirected (symmetric) background constraints: fixed_gaps  - forbidding edges (zeros enforced) fixed_edges - requiring edges (ones enforced)

title: Convert Knowledge to pcalg Knowledge — as_pcalg_constraints
Convert Knowledge to pcalg Knowledge — as_pcalg_constraints
text: kn knowledge object.  Must tier information. labels Character vector variable names, exact order data columns.  Every variable referenced edge kn must appear . directed_as_undirected Logical (default FALSE).  FALSE, require every edge kn mirror-image present well, error missing.  TRUE, automatically mirror every directed edge undirected constraint.

title: Convert Knowledge to pcalg Knowledge — as_pcalg_constraints
text: list two elements, n × n logical matrix corresponding pcalg fixed_gaps fixed_edges arguments.

title: Convert Knowledge to pcalg Knowledge — as_pcalg_constraints
text: function takes knowledge object (forbidden/required edges, tiers) returns two logical matrices exact variable order supply.

title: Convert Knowledge to pcalg Knowledge — as_pcalg_constraints
text: knowledge object contains tiered knowledge. directed_as_undirected = FALSE edge lacks symmetrical counterpart. can hold forbidden edges.

title: Convert Knowledge to pcalg Knowledge — as_pcalg_constraints
code: # pcalg supports undirected constraints; build a tierless knowledge and convert data(tpc_example)  kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   child_x1 %!-->% youth_x3,   youth_x3 %!-->% child_x1 )  pc_constraints <- as_pcalg_constraints(kn, directed_as_undirected = FALSE) print(pc_constraints) #> $fixed_gaps #>           child_x1 child_x2 oldage_x5 oldage_x6 youth_x3 youth_x4 #> child_x1     FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE     TRUE    FALSE #> child_x2     FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #> oldage_x5    FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #> oldage_x6    FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #> youth_x3      TRUE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #> youth_x4     FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #>  #> $fixed_edges #>           child_x1 child_x2 oldage_x5 oldage_x6 youth_x3 youth_x4 #> child_x1     FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #> child_x2     FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #> oldage_x5    FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #> oldage_x6    FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #> youth_x3     FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #> youth_x4     FALSE    FALSE     FALSE     FALSE    FALSE    FALSE #>   # error paths # using tiers kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     oldage ~ starts_with("old")   ),   child_x1 %-->% youth_x3 )  try(as_pcalg_constraints(kn), silent = TRUE) # fails due to tiers  # using directed knowledge kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   child_x1 %!-->% youth_x3 )  try(as_pcalg_constraints(kn), silent = TRUE) # fails due to directed knowledge

code: data(tpc_example)  # Requires Tetrad to be installed if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   # Recommended path using disco()   boss_tetrad <- boss(engine = "tetrad", score = "sem_bic")   disco(tpc_example, boss_tetrad)    # or using boss_tetrad directly   boss_tetrad(tpc_example) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  ---   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  ---   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  #### With tier knowledge #### if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   kn <- knowledge(     tpc_example,     tier(       child ~ tidyselect::starts_with("child"),       youth ~ tidyselect::starts_with("youth"),       oldage ~ tidyselect::starts_with("oldage")     )   )    # Recommended path using disco()   boss_tetrad <- boss(engine = "tetrad", score = "sem_bic")   disco(tpc_example, boss_tetrad, knowledge = kn)    # or using boss_tetrad directly   boss_tetrad <- boss_tetrad |> set_knowledge(kn)   boss_tetrad(tpc_example) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  ---   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # With all algorithm arguments specified if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   boss_tetrad <- boss(     engine = "tetrad",     score = "gic",     num_starts = 2,     use_bes = FALSE,     use_data_order = FALSE,     output_cpdag = FALSE   )   disco(tpc_example, boss_tetrad) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  -->   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

code: data(tpc_example)  # Requires Tetrad to be installed if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   # Recommended path using disco()   boss_fci_tetrad <- boss_fci(     engine = "tetrad",     score = "sem_bic",     test = "fisher_z"   )   disco(tpc_example, boss_fci_tetrad)    # or using boss_fci_tetrad directly   boss_fci_tetrad(tpc_example) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  o-o   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  o->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  o-o   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  o->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  #### With tier knowledge #### if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   kn <- knowledge(     tpc_example,     tier(       child ~ tidyselect::starts_with("child"),       youth ~ tidyselect::starts_with("youth"),       oldage ~ tidyselect::starts_with("oldage")     )   )    # Recommended path using disco()   boss_fci_tetrad <- boss_fci(     engine = "tetrad",     score = "sem_bic",     test = "fisher_z"   )   disco(tpc_example, boss_fci_tetrad, knowledge = kn)    # or using boss_fci_tetrad directly   boss_fci_tetrad <- boss_fci_tetrad |> set_knowledge(kn)   boss_fci_tetrad(tpc_example) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  o-o   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  o->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  o-o   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  o->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # With all algorithm arguments specified if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   boss_fci_tetrad <- boss_fci(     engine = "tetrad",     score = "poisson_prior",     test = "rank_independence",     depth = 3,     max_disc_path_length = 5,     use_bes = FALSE,     use_heuristic = FALSE,     complete_rule_set_used = FALSE,     guarantee_pag = TRUE   )   disco(tpc_example, boss_fci_tetrad) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from     edge  to        #>   <chr>    <chr> <chr>     #> 1 youth_x4 o-o   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

what: causalDisco: Causal Discovery in R — causalDisco-package
title: causalDisco: Causal Discovery in R — causalDisco-package
text: Tools causal structure learning observational data, emphasis temporally ordered variables. package implements Temporal Peter–Clark (TPC) algorithm (Petersen, Osler & Ekstrøm, 2021; doi:10.1093/aje/kwab087 ), Temporal Greedy Equivalence Search (TGES) algorithm (Larsen, Ekstrøm & Petersen, 2025; doi:10.48550/arXiv.2502.06232 ) Temporal Fast Causal Inference (TFCI). provides unified framework specifying background knowledge, can incorporated implemented algorithms R packages 'bnlearn' (Scutari, 2010; doi:10.18637/jss.v035.i03 ) 'pcalg' (Kalish et al., 2012; doi:10.18637/jss.v047.i11 ), well Java application 'Tetrad' (Scheines et al., 1998; doi:10.1207/s15327906mbr3301_3 ). package includes utilities visualization, comparison, evaluation graph structures, facilitating performance evaluation methodological studies.

title: causalDisco: Causal Discovery in R — causalDisco-package
text: Java (>= 21) Tetrad functionality (optional; includes installer; see inst/java/LICENSE inst/java/COPYRIGHT); Source code: https://github.com/cmu-phil/tetrad.

title: Confusion Matrix — confusion
text: Compute confusion matrix two PDAG caugi graphs.

title: Confusion Matrix — confusion
Confusion Matrix — confusion
text: truth caugi object representing truth graph. est caugi object representing estimated graph. type Character string specifying comparison type: "adj": adjacency comparison. "dir": orientation comparison conditional shared adjacencies.

title: Confusion Matrix — confusion
text: list entries tp (truth positives), tn (truth negatives), fp (false positives), fn (false negatives).

title: Confusion Matrix — confusion
text: Adjacency comparison: confusion matrix cross-tabulation adjacencies. Hence, truth positive means two inputs agree presence adjacency. truth negative means two inputs agree adjacency. false positive means estimated graph places adjacency none. false negative means estimated graph place adjacency one. Orientation comparison: orientation confusion matrix conditional agreement adjacency. means adjacencies shared input matrices considered, agreement wrt. orientation computed among edges occur matrices. truth positive correctly placed arrowhead (1), false positive marks placement arrowhead (1) tail (0), false negative marks placement tail (0) arrowhead (1), truth negative marks correct placement tail (0). supports caugi objects edge types present -->, <-->, --- edge.

title: Confusion Matrix — confusion

title: Convert Tiered Knowledge to Forbidden Knowledge — convert_tiers_to_forbidden
code: kn <- knowledge(  tpc_example,  tier(   child ~ starts_with("child"),   youth ~ starts_with("youth"),   old ~ starts_with("old")  ) ) kn_converted <- convert_tiers_to_forbidden(kn) print(kn_converted) #>  #> ── Knowledge object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Variables ── #>  #>   var       tier  #>   <chr>     <chr> #> 1 child_x1  NA    #> 2 child_x2  NA    #> 3 youth_x3  NA    #> 4 youth_x4  NA    #> 5 oldage_x5 NA    #> 6 oldage_x6 NA    #> ── Edges ── #>  #>  ✖  oldage_x5 → child_x1 #>  ✖  oldage_x5 → child_x2 #>  ✖  oldage_x5 → youth_x3 #>  ✖  oldage_x5 → youth_x4 #>  ✖  oldage_x6 → child_x1 #>  ✖  oldage_x6 → child_x2 #>  ✖  oldage_x6 → youth_x3 #>  ✖  oldage_x6 → youth_x4 #>  ✖  youth_x3 → child_x1 #>  ✖  youth_x3 → child_x2 #>  ✖  youth_x4 → child_x1 #>  ✖  youth_x4 → child_x2 plot(kn_converted)

text: kn knowledge object. df_name Optional name data frame used (used first argument knowledge()).  NULL, knowledge() called data frame.

title: Deparse a Knowledge Object into Knowledge DSL Code — deparse_knowledge
text: single string (newlines) R code.

title: Deparse a Knowledge Object into Knowledge DSL Code — deparse_knowledge
code: # turn a knowledge object back into DSL code data(tpc_example)  kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     old ~ starts_with("old")   ),   child_x1 %-->% youth_x3,   oldage_x6 %!-->% child_x1 )  code <- deparse_knowledge(kn, df_name = "tpc_example") cat(code) #> knowledge(tpc_example, #>   tier( #>     child ~ child_x1 + child_x2, #>     youth ~ youth_x3 + youth_x4, #>     old ~ oldage_x5 + oldage_x6 #>   ), #>   child_x1 %-->% youth_x3, #>   oldage_x6 %!-->% child_x1 #> )  # Explicitly add all forbidden edges implied by tiers kn <- convert_tiers_to_forbidden(kn) code <- deparse_knowledge(kn, df_name = "tpc_example") cat(code) #> knowledge(tpc_example, #>   child_x1 %-->% youth_x3, #>   oldage_x5 %!-->% c(child_x1, child_x2, youth_x3, youth_x4), #>   oldage_x6 %!-->% c(child_x1, child_x2, youth_x3, youth_x4), #>   youth_x3 %!-->% c(child_x1, child_x2), #>   youth_x4 %!-->% c(child_x1, child_x2) #> )

title: Perform Causal Discovery — disco
text: Apply causal discovery method data frame infer causal relationships observational data. Supports multiple algorithms optionally incorporates prior knowledge.

title: Perform Causal Discovery — disco
Perform Causal Discovery — disco
text: data data frame. method disco_method object representing causal discovery algorithm. Available methods boss() - BOSS algorithm, boss_fci() - BOSS-FCI algorithm, fci() - FCI algorithm, gfci() - GFCI algorithm, ges() - GES algorithm, grasp() - GRaSP algorithm, grasp_fci() - GRaSP-FCI algorithm, gs() - GS algorithm, iamb(), iamb_fdr(), fast_iamb(), inter_iamb() - IAMB algorithms, pc() - PC algorithm, sp_fci() - SP-FCI algorithm, tfci() - TFCI algorithm, tges() - TGES algorithm, tpc() - TPC algorithm. knowledge knowledge object incorporated disco method. NULL (default), method applied without additional knowledge.

title: Perform Causal Discovery — disco
text: caugi knowledge (knowledgeable_caugi) object.

title: Perform Causal Discovery — disco
text: specific details supported algorithms, scores, tests, parameters engine, see: BnlearnSearch bnlearn, CausalDiscoSearch causalDisco, PcalgSearch pcalg, TetradSearch Tetrad.

title: Perform Causal Discovery — disco
code: data(tpc_example)  # use pc with engine bnlearn and test fisher_z my_pc <- pc(engine = "bnlearn", test = "fisher_z", alpha = 0.01) pc_bnlearn <- disco(data = tpc_example, method = my_pc) plot(pc_bnlearn)   # define tiered background knowledge kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     old ~ starts_with("old")   ) )  # use gs with engine bnlearn and test cor and tiered background knowledge my_pc_tiered <- pc(engine = "bnlearn", test = "cor", alpha = 0.01) pc_tiered_bnlearn <- disco(   data = tpc_example,   method = my_pc_tiered,   knowledge = kn ) plot(pc_tiered_bnlearn)

title: Evaluate Causal Graph Estimates — evaluate
text: Computes various metrics evaluate difference estimated truth causal graph. Designed primarily assessing performance causal discovery algorithms. Metrics supplied list three slots: $adj, $dir, $. $adj Metrics applied adjacency confusion matrix (see confusion()). $dir Metrics applied conditional orientation confusion matrix (see confusion()). $Metrics applied directly adjacency matrices without computing confusion matrices. Adjacency confusion matrix conditional orientation confusion matrix works caugi objects edge types present -->, <-->, --- edge.

title: Evaluate Causal Graph Estimates — evaluate
Evaluate Causal Graph Estimates — evaluate
text: truth truth caugi object. est Estimated caugi object. metrics List metrics, see details. metrics = "", available metrics computed.

title: Evaluate Causal Graph Estimates — evaluate
text: data.frame one column computed metric. Adjacency metrics prefixed "adj_", orientation metrics prefixed "dir_", metrics get prefix.

title: Evaluate Causal Graph Estimates — evaluate
code: cg1 <- caugi::caugi(A %-->% B + C) cg2 <- caugi::caugi(B %-->% A + C) evaluate(cg1, cg2) #>   adj_precision adj_recall adj_specificity adj_false_omission_rate adj_fdr #> 1           0.5        0.5               0                       1     0.5 #>   adj_npv adj_f1_score adj_g1_score dir_precision dir_recall dir_specificity #> 1       0          0.5            0             0          0               0 #>   dir_false_omission_rate dir_fdr dir_npv dir_f1_score dir_g1_score shd hd #> 1                       1       1       0            0            0   3  0 #>         aid #> 1 0.6666667 evaluate(   cg1,   cg2,   metrics = list(     adj = c("precision", "recall"),     dir = c("f1_score"),     other = c("shd")   ) ) #>   adj_precision adj_recall dir_f1_score shd #> 1           0.5        0.5            0   3

title: F1 score — f1_score
text: Computes F1 score two caugi objects. converts caugi objects adjacency matrices computes F1 score \(2 \cdot TP/(2 \cdot TP + FP + FN)\), TP truth positives, FP false positives, FN false negatives. TP + FP + FN = 0, 1 returned. supports caugi objects edge types present -->, <-->, --- edge.

title: F1 score — f1_score
F1 score — f1_score
text: truth caugi object representing truth graph. est caugi object representing estimated graph. type Character string specifying comparison type: "adj": adjacency comparison. "dir": orientation comparison conditional shared adjacencies.

title: F1 score — f1_score
text: numeric [0,1].

title: F1 score — f1_score
code: cg1 <- caugi::caugi(A %-->% B + C) cg2 <- caugi::caugi(B %-->% A + C) f1_score(cg1, cg2, type = "adj") #> [1] 0.5 f1_score(cg1, cg2, type = "dir") #> [1] 0

title: False Omission Rate — false_omission_rate
text: Computes false omission rate two PDAG caugi objects. converts caugi objects adjacency matrices computes false omission rate FN/(FN + TN), FN false negatives TN truth negatives. FN + TN = 0, 1 returned. supports caugi objects edge types present -->, <-->, --- edge.

False Omission Rate — false_omission_rate

title: False Omission Rate — false_omission_rate

title: FCI Algorithm for Causal Discovery — fci
text: specific details supported tests parameters engine, see: TetradSearch Tetrad, PcalgSearch pcalg.

title: FCI Algorithm for Causal Discovery — fci
code: data(tpc_example)  # Recommended path using disco() fci_pcalg <- fci(engine = "pcalg", test = "fisher_z", alpha = 0.05) disco(tpc_example, fci_pcalg) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  o-o   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  o->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  o-o   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  o->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # or using fci_pcalg directly fci_pcalg(tpc_example) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  o-o   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  o->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  o-o   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  o->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # With all algorithm arguments specified fci_pcalg <- fci(   engine = "pcalg",   test = "fisher_z",   alpha = 0.05,   skel.method = "original",   type = "anytime",   fixedGaps = NULL,   fixedEdges = NULL,   NAdelete = FALSE,   m.max = 10,   pdsep.max = 2,   rules = c(rep(TRUE, 9), FALSE),   doPdsep = FALSE,   biCC = TRUE,   conservative = TRUE,   maj.rule = FALSE,   numCores = 1,   selectionBias = FALSE,   jci = "1",   verbose = FALSE ) disco(tpc_example, fci_pcalg) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  o-o   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  o->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  o-o   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  o->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  #### Using tetrad engine with tier knowledge #### # Requires Tetrad to be installed if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   kn <- knowledge(     tpc_example,     tier(       child ~ tidyselect::starts_with("child"),       youth ~ tidyselect::starts_with("youth"),       oldage ~ tidyselect::starts_with("oldage")     )   )    # Recommended path using disco()   fci_tetrad <- fci(engine = "tetrad", test = "fisher_z", alpha = 0.05)   disco(tpc_example, fci_tetrad, knowledge = kn)    # or using fci_tetrad directly   fci_tetrad <- fci_tetrad |> set_knowledge(kn)   fci_tetrad(tpc_example) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  o-o   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  o->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  o-o   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  o->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # With all algorithm arguments specified if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   fci_tetrad <- fci(     engine = "tetrad",     test = "fisher_z",     alpha = 0.05,     complete_rule_set_used = FALSE,     max_disc_path_length = 4,     depth = 10,     stable_fas = FALSE,     guarantee_pag = TRUE   )   disco(tpc_example, fci_tetrad) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  o->   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  <->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  <->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x6 <->   oldage_x5 #> 5 youth_x3  o->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  <->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

title: False Discovery Rate — fdr
text: Computes false discovery rate two PDAG caugi objects. converts caugi objects adjacency matrices computes false discovery rate FP/(FP + TP), FP false positives TP truth positives. FP + TP = 0, 1 returned. supports caugi objects edge types present -->, <-->, --- edge.

title: False Discovery Rate — fdr
False Discovery Rate — fdr
text: truth caugi object representing truth graph. est caugi object representing estimated graph. type Character string specifying comparison type: "adj": adjacency comparison. "dir": orientation comparison conditional shared adjacencies.

title: False Discovery Rate — fdr
text: numeric [0,1].

title: False Discovery Rate — fdr
code: cg1 <- caugi::caugi(A %-->% B + C) cg2 <- caugi::caugi(B %-->% A + C) fdr(cg1, cg2, type = "adj") #> [1] 0.5 fdr(cg1, cg2, type = "dir") #> [1] 1

what: Add Forbidden Edges to Knowledge — forbid_edge
title: Add Forbidden Edges to Knowledge — forbid_edge
text: Forbid one directed edges. argument must two–sided formula, e.g. X ~ Y. Formulas can use tidy-select either side, forbid_edge(kn, starts_with("X") ~ Y) forbids every X_i --> Y.

title: Add Forbidden Edges to Knowledge — forbid_edge
Add Forbidden Edges to Knowledge — forbid_edge
text: kn knowledge object. ... One two-sided formulas.

title: Add Forbidden Edges to Knowledge — forbid_edge
text: updated knowledge object.

title: Add Forbidden Edges to Knowledge — forbid_edge
code: data(tpc_example)  # create knowledge object using verbs kn1 <- knowledge() |>   add_vars(names(tpc_example)) |>   add_tier(child) |>   add_tier(old, after = child) |>   add_tier(youth, before = old) |>   add_to_tier(child ~ starts_with("child")) |>   add_to_tier(youth ~ starts_with("youth")) |>   add_to_tier(old ~ starts_with("oldage")) |>   require_edge(child_x1 ~ youth_x3) |>   forbid_edge(child_x2 ~ youth_x4) |>   add_exogenous(child_x1) # synonym: add_exo()  # set kn1 to frozen # (meaning you cannot add variables to the knowledge object anymore) # this is to get a true on the identical check kn1$frozen <- TRUE  # create identical knowledge object using DSL kn2 <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     old ~ starts_with("oldage")   ),   child_x1 %-->% youth_x3,   child_x2 %!-->% youth_x4,   exo(child_x1) # synonym: exogenous() )  print(identical(kn1, kn2)) #> [1] TRUE  # cannot require an edge against tier direction try(   kn1 |> require_edge(oldage_x6 ~ child_x1) ) #> Error : Edge(s) violate tier ordering: oldage_x6 --> child_x1  # cannot forbid and require same edge try(   kn1 |> forbid_edge(child_x1 ~ youth_x3) ) #> Error : Edge(s) appear as both forbidden and required: child_x1 --> youth_x3

title: G1 score — g1_score
text: Computes G1 score two caugi objects. converts caugi objects adjacency matrices computes G1 score defined \(2 \cdot TN/(2 \cdot TN + FN + FP)\), TN truth negatives, FP false positives, FN false negatives. TN + FN + FP = 0, 1 returned. supports caugi objects edge types present -->, <-->, --- edge.

title: G1 score — g1_score
G1 score — g1_score
text: truth caugi object representing truth graph. est caugi object representing estimated graph. type Character string specifying comparison type: "adj": adjacency comparison. "dir": orientation comparison conditional shared adjacencies.

title: G1 score — g1_score
text: numeric [0,1].

title: G1 score — g1_score
text: Petersen, Anne Helby, et al. "Causal discovery observational sciences using supervised machine learning." arXiv preprint arXiv:2202.12813 (2022).

title: G1 score — g1_score
code: cg1 <- caugi::caugi(A %-->% B + C) cg2 <- caugi::caugi(B %-->% A + C) g1_score(cg1, cg2, type = "adj") #> [1] 0 g1_score(cg1, cg2, type = "dir") #> [1] 0

what: Generate Synthetic Data from a Linear Gaussian DAG — generate_dag_data
title: Generate Synthetic Data from a Linear Gaussian DAG — generate_dag_data
text: Generates synthetic data directed acyclic graph (DAG) specified caugi graph object. node modeled linear combination parents plus additive Gaussian noise. Coefficients randomly signed minimum absolute value, noise standard deviations sampled log-uniformly specified range. Custom node equations can override automatic linear generation.

title: Generate Synthetic Data from a Linear Gaussian DAG — generate_dag_data
code: generate_dag_data(   cg,   n,   ...,   standardize = TRUE,   coef_range = c(0.1, 0.9),   error_sd = c(0.3, 2),   seed = NULL )

title: Generate Synthetic Data from a Linear Gaussian DAG — generate_dag_data
text: cg caugi graph object representing DAG. n Integer. Number observations simulate. ... Optional named node equations override automatic linear generation. expression referencing parent nodes. standardize Logical. TRUE, column output standardized mean 0 standard deviation 1. coef_range Numeric vector length 2. Specifies minimum maximum absolute value edge coefficients. Coefficients randomly assigned positive negative sign. Must satisfy coef_range[1] > 0 coef_range[2] >= coef_range[1]. error_sd Numeric vector length 2. Specifies range standard deviations additive Gaussian noise node. separate SD sampled node log-uniform distribution. Must satisfy error_sd[1] > 0 error_sd[2] >= error_sd[1]. seed Optional integer. Sets random seed reproducibility.

title: Generate Synthetic Data from a Linear Gaussian DAG — generate_dag_data
text: tibble simulated data one column per node DAG, ordered according graph's node order. Standardization applied standardize = TRUE. returned tibble attribute generating_model, list containing: sd: Named numeric vector node-specific noise standard deviations. coef: Named list numeric vectors, element corresponds child node. child node, vector stores coefficients parent nodes linear structural equation. : generating_model$coef[[child]][parent] gives coefficient parent equation child.

title: Generate Synthetic Data from a Linear Gaussian DAG — generate_dag_data
code: cg <- caugi::caugi(A %-->% B, B %-->% C, A %-->% C, class = "DAG")  # Simulate 1000 observations sim_data <- generate_dag_data(   cg,   n = 1000,   coef_range = c(0.2, 0.8),   error_sd = c(0.5, 1.5) )  head(sim_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>        A        B        C #>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 -0.530  0.00875 -0.147   #> 2  0.680 -1.10     0.357   #> 3  0.543  0.948   -0.542   #> 4  1.04  -0.907    0.00363 #> 5 -2.17   1.28     0.236   #> 6 -0.817  2.83    -2.01    attr(sim_data, "generating_model") #> $dgp #> $dgp$A #> rnorm(n, sd = 0.83) #>  #> $dgp$B #> A * -0.67 + rnorm(n, sd = 1.125) #>  #> $dgp$C #> A * -0.792 + B * -0.667 + rnorm(n, sd = 0.718) #>  #>   # Simulate with custom equation for node C sim_data_custom <- generate_dag_data(   cg,   n = 1000,   C = A^2 + B + rnorm(n, sd = 0.7),   seed = 1405 ) head(sim_data_custom) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>         A      B      C #>     <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1  0.301   0.148 -0.114 #> 2 -1.13    2.02   1.71  #> 3  0.727  -0.719 -0.696 #> 4 -0.179   0.781  0.276 #> 5  0.0492  0.840  0.449 #> 6  0.179   0.232 -0.641 attr(sim_data_custom, "generating_model") #> $dgp #> $dgp$A #> rnorm(n, sd = 0.95) #>  #> $dgp$B #> A * -0.856 + rnorm(n, sd = 1.266) #>  #> $dgp$C #> A^2 + B + rnorm(n, sd = 0.7) #>  #>

or using ges_pcalg directly ges_pcalg(tpc_example) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  ---   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # With all algorithm arguments specified ges_pcalg <- ges(   engine = "pcalg",   score = "sem_bic",   adaptive = "vstructures",   phase = "forward",   iterate = FALSE,   maxDegree = 3,   verbose = FALSE ) disco(tpc_example, ges_pcalg) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  ---   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────   #### Using tetrad engine with tier knowledge #### # Requires Tetrad to be installed if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   kn <- knowledge(     tpc_example,     tier(       child ~ tidyselect::starts_with("child"),       youth ~ tidyselect::starts_with("youth"),       oldage ~ tidyselect::starts_with("oldage")     )   )    # Recommended path using disco()   ges_tetrad <- ges(engine = "tetrad", score = "sem_bic")   disco(tpc_example, ges_tetrad, knowledge = kn)    # or using ges_tetrad directly   ges_tetrad <- ges_tetrad |> set_knowledge(kn)   ges_tetrad(tpc_example) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  ---   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # With all algorithm arguments specified if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   ges_tetrad <- ges(     engine = "tetrad",     score = "ebic",     symmetric_first_step = TRUE,     max_degree = 3,     parallelized = TRUE,     faithfulness_assumed = TRUE   )   disco(tpc_example, ges_tetrad) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  ---   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  ---   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Recommended path using disco()   grasp_tetrad <- grasp(     engine = "tetrad",     test = "fisher_z",     score = "sem_bic",     alpha = 0.05   )   disco(tpc_example, grasp_tetrad, knowledge = kn)    # or using grasp_tetrad directly   grasp_tetrad <- grasp_tetrad |> set_knowledge(kn)   grasp_tetrad(tpc_example) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  ---   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # With all algorithm arguments specified if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   grasp_tetrad <- grasp_fci(     engine = "tetrad",     test = "poisson_prior",     score = "rank_bic",     alpha = 0.05,     depth = 3,     stable_fas = FALSE,     max_disc_path_length = 5,     covered_depth = 3,     singular_depth = 2,     nonsingular_depth = 2,     ordered_alg = TRUE,     raskutti_uhler = TRUE,     use_data_order = FALSE,     num_starts = 3   )   disco(tpc_example, grasp_tetrad) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  o-o   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  o->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  o-o   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  o->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

title: GS Algorithm for Causal Discovery — gs
code: data(tpc_example)  kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   starts_with("child") %-->% starts_with("youth") )   # Recommended path using disco() gs_bnlearn <- gs(   engine = "bnlearn",   test = "fisher_z",   alpha = 0.05 ) disco(tpc_example, gs_bnlearn, knowledge = kn) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  -->   youth_x3  #> 3 child_x1  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 5 child_x2  -->   youth_x3  #> 6 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 7 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 8 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 9 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Variables ── #>  #>   var       tier  #>   <chr>     <chr> #> 1 child_x1  NA    #> 2 child_x2  NA    #> 3 oldage_x5 NA    #> 4 oldage_x6 NA    #> 5 youth_x3  NA    #> 6 youth_x4  NA    #> ── Edges ── #>  #>  ✔  child_x1 → youth_x3 #>  ✔  child_x1 → youth_x4 #>  ✔  child_x2 → youth_x3 #>  ✔  child_x2 → youth_x4  # or using gs_bnlearn directly gs_bnlearn <- gs_bnlearn |> set_knowledge(kn) gs_bnlearn(tpc_example) #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  -->   youth_x3  #> 3 child_x1  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 5 child_x2  -->   youth_x3  #> 6 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 7 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 8 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 9 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────   # With all algorithm arguments specified gs_bnlearn <- gs(   engine = "bnlearn",   test = "fisher_z",   alpha = 0.05,   max.sx = 2,   debug = FALSE,   undirected = TRUE )  disco(tpc_example, gs_bnlearn) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  ---   oldage_x6 #> 3 child_x2  ---   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x6 ---   youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 ---   youth_x4  #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

title: Install Eclipse Temurin JDK 25 — install_java
text: Installs Eclipse Temurin JDK 25 user's home directory configures environment JDK immediately available current R session. function also sets JAVA_HOME environment variable ensure packages rJava work without additional configuration. helper function intended users prefer automated installation find inconvenient manually download install Java Adoptium website (https://adoptium.net/temurin/releases). Linux supported helper, Java typically installed via system package manager.

title: Install Eclipse Temurin JDK 25 — install_java
Install Eclipse Temurin JDK 25 — install_java
text: force Logical; TRUE, forces reinstallation even JDK already present. Default FALSE.

title: Install Eclipse Temurin JDK 25 — install_java
Install Tetrad GUI — install_tetrad
text: function downloads installs Tetrad GUI JAR file specified directory. also sets TETRAD_DIR environment variable future R sessions.

title: Install Tetrad GUI — install_tetrad
code: install_tetrad(   version = getOption("causalDisco.tetrad.version"),   dir = NULL,   set_renviron = TRUE,   force = FALSE )

title: Install Tetrad GUI — install_tetrad
text: version Character. version Tetrad install. Default "7.6.10". Use options(causalDisco.tetrad.version = "...") change default version. dir Character. directory install Tetrad . Default "~/tetrad". set_renviron Logical. Whether set TETRAD_DIR .Renviron. Default TRUE. force Logical. Whether force re-download file already exists. Default FALSE.

title: Install Tetrad GUI — install_tetrad
text: Invisible character string path downloaded JAR file.

title: Install Tetrad GUI — install_tetrad
Knowledge Mini-DSL Constructor — knowledge
text: Constructs knowledge object optionally initialized data frame extended variable relationships expressed via formulas, selectors, infix operators:
code: tier(1 ~ V1 + V2, exposure ~ E) V1 %-->% V3    # infix syntax for required edge from V1 to V3 V2 %!-->% V3    # infix syntax for an edge from V2 to V3 that is forbidden exogenous(V1, V2)

title: Knowledge Mini-DSL Constructor — knowledge
Knowledge Mini-DSL Constructor — knowledge
text: ... Arguments define knowledge object: Optionally, single data frame (first argument) whose column names initialize freeze variable set. Zero mini-DSL calls: tier(), exogenous(), exo(), infix operators %-->%, %!-->%. tier(): One two-sided formulas (tier(1 ~ x + y)), numeric vector. exogenous() / exo(): Variable names tidyselect selectors. Arguments evaluated order; calls allowed.

title: Knowledge Mini-DSL Constructor — knowledge
text: populated knowledge object.

title: Knowledge Mini-DSL Constructor — knowledge
text: Create knowledge object using concise mini-DSL tier(), exogenous() infix edge operators %-->% %!-->%. first argument can data frame, used populate knowledge object variable names. later add variables add_* verbs, throw warning, since knowledge object frozen. can unfreeze knowledge object using function unfreeze(knowledge). data frame provided, object initially empty. Variables can added via tier(), forbidden(), required(), infix operators, add_vars(). tier(): Assigns variables tiers. Tiers may numeric string labels. left-hand side (LHS) formula tier; right-hand side (RHS) specifies variables. Variables can also selected using tidyselect syntax: tier(1 ~ starts_with("V")). %-->% %!-->%: Infix operators define required forbidden edges, respectively. sides operator can use tidyselect syntax select multiple variables. exogenous() / exo(): Mark variables exogenous. Numeric vector shortcut tier(): tier(c(1, 2, 1)) assigns tiers index existing variables. Multiple calls operators additive: call adds new edges knowledge object. example:   results edges required - .e., union specified required edges.

title: Knowledge Mini-DSL Constructor — knowledge
code: data(tpc_example)  # Knowledge objects can contain tier information, forbidden and required edges kn <- knowledge(   tier(     1 ~ V1 + V2,     2 ~ V3   ),   V1 %-->% V2,   V3 %!-->% V1 )  # If a data frame is provided, variable names are checked against it kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     1 ~ child_x1 + child_x2,     2 ~ youth_x3 + youth_x4,     3 ~ oldage_x5 + oldage_x6   ) )  # Throws error if variable not in data try(   knowledge(     tpc_example,     tier(       1 ~ child_x1 + child_x2,       2 ~ youth_x3 + youth_x4,       3 ~ oldage_x5 + woops     )   ) ) #>  #> ── Knowledge object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Tiers ── #>  #>   tier  #>   <chr> #> 1 1     #> 2 2     #> 3 3     #> ── Variables ── #>  #>   var       tier  #>   <chr>     <chr> #> 1 child_x1  1     #> 2 child_x2  1     #> 3 youth_x3  2     #> 4 youth_x4  2     #> 5 oldage_x5 3     #> 6 oldage_x6 NA     # Using tidyselect helpers kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     1 ~ starts_with("child"),     2 ~ ends_with(c("_x3", "_x4")),     3 ~ starts_with("oldage")   ) )  # Numeric vector shortcut kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(c(1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 3)) )  # Custom tier naming kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     elderly ~ starts_with("oldage")   ) )  # There is also required and forbidden edges, which are specified like so kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   child_x1 %-->% youth_x3,   oldage_x6 %!-->% child_x1 )  # You can also add exogenous variables kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   exogenous(child_x1),   exo(child_x2) # shorthand )  # Mix different operators kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     1 ~ starts_with("child") + youth_x4,     2 ~ youth_x3 + starts_with("oldage")   ),   child_x1 %-->% youth_x3,   oldage_x6 %!-->% oldage_x5,   exo(child_x2) )  # You can also build knowledge with a verb pipeline kn <-   knowledge() |>   add_vars(c("A", "B", "C", "D")) |> # Knowledge now only takes these variables   add_tier(One) |>   add_to_tier(One ~ A + B) |>   add_tier(2, after = One) |>   add_to_tier(2 ~ C + D) |>   forbid_edge(A ~ C) |>   require_edge(A ~ B)  # Mix DSL start + verb refinement kn <-   knowledge(     tier(1 ~ V5, 2 ~ V6),     V5 %!-->% V6   ) |>   add_tier(3, after = "2") |>   add_to_tier(3 ~ V7) |>   add_exo(V2) |>   add_exogenous(V3)  # Using seq_tiers for larger datasets large_data <- as.data.frame(   matrix(     runif(100),     nrow = 1,     ncol = 100,     byrow = TRUE   ) )  names(large_data) <- paste0("X_", 1:100)  kn <- knowledge(   large_data,   tier(     seq_tiers(       1:100,       ends_with("_{i}")     )   ),   X_1 %-->% X_2 )  small_data <- data.frame(   X_1 = 1,   X_2 = 2,   tier3_A = 3,   Y5_ok = 4,   check.names = FALSE )  kn <- knowledge(   small_data,   tier(     seq_tiers(1:2, ends_with("_{i}")),     seq_tiers(3, starts_with("tier{i}")),     seq_tiers(5, matches("Y{i}_ok"))   ) )

what: Generate TikZ Code from a Object — make_tikz
title: Generate TikZ Code from a Object — make_tikz
text: Generates LaTeX TikZ code knowledgeable_caugi, knowledge, caugi::caugi object, preserving node positions, labels, visual styles. Edges rendered arrows, line widths, colors. output readable LaTeX code can directly compiled modified.

title: Generate TikZ Code from a Object — make_tikz
code: make_tikz(   x,   ...,   scale = 10,   full_doc = TRUE,   bend_edges = FALSE,   bend_angle = 25,   tier_label_pos = c("above", "below", "left", "right") )

title: Generate TikZ Code from a Object — make_tikz
text: x knowledgeable_caugi, knowledge, caugi::caugi object. ... Additional arguments passed plot() caugi::plot(). scale Numeric scalar. Scaling factor node coordinates. Default 10. full_doc Logical. TRUE (default), generates full standalone LaTeX document. FALSE, returns tikzpicture environment. bend_edges Logical. TRUE, edges drawn bent edges. Default FALSE. Edges connecting pair nodes directions (%-->% B B %-->% ) automatically bent left right avoid overlap. Bend direction automatically chosen reduce overlap. bend_angle Numeric scalar. Angle degrees bending arrows bend_edges = TRUE. Default 25. tier_label_pos Character string specifying position tier labels relative tier rectangles. Must one "", "", "left", "right". Default "".

title: Generate TikZ Code from a Object — make_tikz
text: character string containing LaTeX TikZ code. Depending full_doc, either: complete LaTeX document (full_doc = TRUE), tikzpicture environment (full_doc = FALSE).

title: Generate TikZ Code from a Object — make_tikz
text: function calls plot() generate caugi::caugi_plot object, traverses plot object's grob structure extract nodes edges. Supported features include: Nodes Fill color draw color (supports named colors custom RGB values) Font size Coordinates scaled scale parameter Edges Line color width Arrow scale Optional bending reduce overlapping arrows generated TikZ code uses global style settings, edges connected nodes name (opposed hard-coded coordinates), making easy modify output needed.

title: Generate TikZ Code from a Object — make_tikz
code:
################# Convert Knowledge to Tikz ################  data(num_data) kn <- knowledge(   num_data,   X1 %-->% X2,   X2 %!-->% c(X3, Y),   Y %!-->% Z )  # Full standalone document tikz_kn <- make_tikz(kn, scale = 10, full_doc = TRUE) cat(tikz_kn) #> %%% Generated by causalDisco (version 0.9.5.9048) #> \documentclass[tikz,border=2mm]{standalone} #> \usetikzlibrary{arrows.meta, positioning, shapes.geometric, fit, backgrounds, calc} #>  #>  egin{document} #> 	ikzset{every node/.style={fill=lightgray}, every path/.style={draw=red}} #> 	ikzset{arrows={[scale=3]}, arrow/.style={-{Stealth}, thick}} #>  egin{tikzpicture} #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X1) at (1.667,0) {X1}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X2) at (1.667,3.333) {X2}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X3) at (3.333,6.667) {X3}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (Y) at (0,6.667) {Y}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (Z) at (0,10) {Z}; #> \path (X1) edge[draw=blue, -Latex] (X2) #>       (X2) edge[, -Latex] (X3) #>       (X2) edge[, -Latex] (Y) #>       (Y) edge[, -Latex] (Z); #> \end{tikzpicture} #> \end{document}  # Only the tikzpicture environment tikz_kn_snippet <- make_tikz(kn, full_doc = FALSE) cat(tikz_kn_snippet) #> %%% Generated by causalDisco (version 0.9.5.9048) #> 	ikzset{every node/.style={fill=lightgray}, every path/.style={draw=red}} #> 	ikzset{arrows={[scale=3]}, arrow/.style={-{Stealth}, thick}} #>  egin{tikzpicture} #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X1) at (1.667,0) {X1}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X2) at (1.667,3.333) {X2}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X3) at (3.333,6.667) {X3}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (Y) at (0,6.667) {Y}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (Z) at (0,10) {Z}; #> \path (X1) edge[draw=blue, -Latex] (X2) #>       (X2) edge[, -Latex] (X3) #>       (X2) edge[, -Latex] (Y) #>       (Y) edge[, -Latex] (Z); #> \end{tikzpicture}  # With bent edges tikz_bent <- make_tikz(   kn,   full_doc = FALSE,   bend_edges = TRUE ) cat(tikz_bent) #> %%% Generated by causalDisco (version 0.9.5.9048) #> 	ikzset{every node/.style={fill=lightgray}, every path/.style={draw=red}} #> 	ikzset{arrows={[scale=3]}, arrow/.style={-{Stealth}, thick}} #>  egin{tikzpicture} #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X1) at (1.667,0) {X1}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X2) at (1.667,3.333) {X2}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X3) at (3.333,6.667) {X3}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (Y) at (0,6.667) {Y}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (Z) at (0,10) {Z}; #> \path (X1) edge[draw=blue, bend left=25, -Latex] (X2) #>       (X2) edge[bend left=25, -Latex] (X3) #>       (X2) edge[bend right=25, -Latex] (Y) #>       (Y) edge[bend left=25, -Latex] (Z); #> \end{tikzpicture}  # With a color not supported by default TikZ colors; will fall back to RGB tikz_darkblue <- make_tikz(   kn,   node_style = list(fill = "darkblue"),   full_doc = FALSE ) cat(tikz_darkblue) #> %%% Generated by causalDisco (version 0.9.5.9048) #> 	ikzset{every node/.style={fill={rgb:red,0.000;green,0.000;blue,0.545}}, every path/.style={draw=red}} #> 	ikzset{arrows={[scale=3]}, arrow/.style={-{Stealth}, thick}} #>  egin{tikzpicture} #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X1) at (1.667,0) {X1}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X2) at (1.667,3.333) {X2}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X3) at (3.333,6.667) {X3}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (Y) at (0,6.667) {Y}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (Z) at (0,10) {Z}; #> \path (X1) edge[draw=blue, -Latex] (X2) #>       (X2) edge[, -Latex] (X3) #>       (X2) edge[, -Latex] (Y) #>       (Y) edge[, -Latex] (Z); #> \end{tikzpicture}  # With tiered knowledge data(tpc_example) kn_tiered <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     old ~ starts_with("old")   ) ) tikz_tiered_kn <- make_tikz(   kn_tiered,   full_doc = FALSE ) cat(tikz_tiered_kn) #> %%% Generated by causalDisco (version 0.9.5.9048) #> 	ikzset{every node/.style={fill=lightgray}} #> 	ikzset{arrows={[scale=1]}, arrow/.style={-{Stealth}, thick}} #>  egin{tikzpicture} #> 
ode[draw, circle] (child_x1) at (0,0) {child\_x1}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (child_x2) at (0,10) {child\_x2}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (youth_x3) at (5,0) {youth\_x3}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (youth_x4) at (5,10) {youth\_x4}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (oldage_x5) at (10,0) {oldage\_x5}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (oldage_x6) at (10,10) {oldage\_x6}; #>  egin{scope}[on background layer] #> 
ode[draw, rectangle, fill=blue!20, rounded corners, inner sep=0.5cm, fit=(child_x1)(child_x2)] (child) {}; #> 
ode[draw, rectangle, fill=blue!20, rounded corners, inner sep=0.5cm, fit=(oldage_x5)(oldage_x6)] (old) {}; #> 
ode[draw, rectangle, fill=blue!20, rounded corners, inner sep=0.5cm, fit=(youth_x3)(youth_x4)] (youth) {}; #> \end{scope} #> 
ode[anchor=south, draw=none, fill=none] at ($(child.north)+(0cm,0.2cm)$) {child}; #> 
ode[anchor=south, draw=none, fill=none] at ($(old.north)+(0cm,0.2cm)$) {old}; #> 
ode[anchor=south, draw=none, fill=none] at ($(youth.north)+(0cm,0.2cm)$) {youth}; #> \path ; #> \end{tikzpicture}   ################# Convert Knowledgeable Caugi to Tikz ################  data(num_data) kn <- knowledge(   num_data,   X1 %-->% X2,   X2 %!-->% c(X3, Y),   Y %!-->% Z )  pc_bnlearn <- pc(engine = "bnlearn", test = "fisher_z", alpha = 0.05) disco_kn <- disco(data = num_data, method = pc_bnlearn, knowledge = kn)  tikz_snippet <- make_tikz(disco_kn, scale = 10, full_doc = FALSE) cat(tikz_snippet) #> %%% Generated by causalDisco (version 0.9.5.9048) #> 	ikzset{every node/.style={fill=lightgray}, every path/.style={draw=blue}} #> 	ikzset{arrows={[scale=3]}, arrow/.style={-{Stealth}, thick}} #>  egin{tikzpicture} #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X1) at (2.609,3.549) {X1}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X2) at (7.431,3.545) {X2}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (X3) at (10,0) {X3}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (Z) at (0,0.013) {Z}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (Y) at (5.007,0.226) {Y}; #> \path (X1) edge[, -Latex] (X2) #>       (X1) edge[, -Latex] (Y) #>       (X1) edge[, -] (Z) #>       (X3) edge[, -Latex] (X2) #>       (X3) edge[, -Latex] (Y) #>       (Y) edge[, -Latex] (X2) #>       (Z) edge[, -Latex] (Y); #> \end{tikzpicture}  ################# Convert caugi objects to Tikz ################  cg <- caugi::caugi(A %-->% B + C)  tikz_snippet <- make_tikz(   cg,   node_style = list(fill = "red"),   scale = 10,   full_doc = FALSE ) cat(tikz_snippet) #> %%% Generated by causalDisco (version 0.9.5.9048) #> 	ikzset{every node/.style={fill=red}} #> 	ikzset{arrows={[scale=3]}, arrow/.style={-{Stealth}, thick}} #>  egin{tikzpicture} #> 
ode[draw, circle] (A) at (5,0) {A}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (B) at (10,10) {B}; #> 
ode[draw, circle] (C) at (0,10) {C}; #> \path (A) edge[, -Latex] (B) #>       (A) edge[, -Latex] (C); #> \end{tikzpicture}

title: Negative Predictive Value — npv
text: Computes negative predictive value two PDAG caugi objects. converts caugi objects adjacency matrices computes negative predictive value TN/(TN + FN), TN truth negatives FN false negatives. TN + FN = 0, 1 returned. supports caugi objects edge types present -->, <-->, --- edge.

title: Negative Predictive Value — npv
Negative Predictive Value — npv
text: truth caugi object representing truth graph. est caugi object representing estimated graph. type Character string specifying comparison type: "adj": adjacency comparison. "dir": orientation comparison conditional shared adjacencies.

title: Negative Predictive Value — npv
text: numeric [0,1].

title: Negative Predictive Value — npv
code: cg1 <- caugi::caugi(A %-->% B + C) cg2 <- caugi::caugi(B %-->% A + C) npv(cg1, cg2, type = "adj") #> [1] 0 npv(cg1, cg2, type = "dir") #> [1] 0

title: Simulated Numerical Data — num_data
text: Simulated Numerical Data

title: Simulated Numerical Data — num_data
Simulated Numerical Data — num_data
text: data.frame 1000 rows 5 variables. X1 Structural equation: \(X_1 := \sqrt{Z} + \epsilon_1\) \(\epsilon_1 \sim \mathrm{Unif}[0, 2]\) X2 Structural equation: \(X_2 := 2 \cdot X_3 - \epsilon_2\) \(\epsilon_2 \sim N(5, 1)\) X3 Structural equation: \(X_3 := \epsilon_3\) \(\epsilon_3 \sim \mathrm{Unif}[5, 10]\) Z Structural equation: \(Z := |\epsilon_4|\) \(\epsilon_4 \sim N(10, 1)\) Y Structural equation: \(Y := X_1^2 + X_2 - X_3 - Z + \epsilon_5\) \(\epsilon_5 \sim N(10, 1)\)

title: Simulated Numerical Data — num_data
text: R code used generate dataset follows:
code: set.seed(1405) n <- 1000 Z <- abs(rnorm(n, mean = 10)) X1 <- sqrt(Z) + runif(n, min = 0, max = 2) X3 <- runif(n, min = 5, max = 10) X2 <- 2 * X3 - rnorm(n, mean = 5) Y  <- X1^2 + X2 - X3 - Z + rnorm(n, mean = 10) num_data <- data.frame(X1, X2, X3, Z, Y)

title: Simulated Numerical Data — num_data

"bnlearn" bnlearn R package. test Character; name conditional‐independence test. alpha Numeric; significance level CI tests. ... Additional arguments passed chosen engine (e.g. test algorithm parameters).

title: PC Algorithm for Causal Discovery — pc
text: function class "pc" takes single argument data (data frame) returns caugi (class "PDAG") knowledge object.

title: PC Algorithm for Causal Discovery — pc
text: specific details supported tests parameters engine, see: TetradSearch Tetrad, PcalgSearch pcalg, BnlearnSearch bnlearn.

title: PC Algorithm for Causal Discovery — pc
code: data(tpc_example)  #### Using pcalg engine #### # Recommended path using disco() pc_pcalg <- pc(engine = "pcalg", test = "fisher_z", alpha = 0.05) disco(tpc_example, pc_pcalg) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  ---   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # or using pc_pcalg directly pc_pcalg(tpc_example) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  ---   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # With all algorithm arguments specified pc_pcalg <- pc(   engine = "pcalg",   test = "fisher_z",   alpha = 0.05,   fixedGaps = NULL,   fixedEdges = NULL,   NAdelete = FALSE,   m.max = 10,   u2pd = "relaxed",   skel.method = "original",   conservative = TRUE,   maj.rule = FALSE,   solve.confl = TRUE,   numCores = 1,   verbose = FALSE )  #### Using bnlearn engine with required knowledge #### kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   starts_with("child") %-->% starts_with("youth") )   # Recommended path using disco() pc_bnlearn <- pc(engine = "bnlearn", test = "fisher_z", alpha = 0.05) disco(tpc_example, pc_bnlearn, knowledge = kn) #> Warning: vstructure youth_x4 -> oldage_x6 <- oldage_x5 is not applicable, because one or both arcs are oriented in the opposite direction. #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  -->   youth_x3  #> 3 child_x1  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 child_x2  ---   oldage_x5 #> 5 child_x2  -->   youth_x3  #> 6 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 7 oldage_x5 ---   oldage_x6 #> 8 oldage_x5 -->   youth_x3  #> 9 oldage_x6 -->   youth_x4  #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Variables ── #>  #>   var       tier  #>   <chr>     <chr> #> 1 child_x1  NA    #> 2 child_x2  NA    #> 3 oldage_x5 NA    #> 4 oldage_x6 NA    #> 5 youth_x3  NA    #> 6 youth_x4  NA    #> ── Edges ── #>  #>  ✔  child_x1 → youth_x3 #>  ✔  child_x1 → youth_x4 #>  ✔  child_x2 → youth_x3 #>  ✔  child_x2 → youth_x4  # or using pc_bnlearn directly pc_bnlearn <- pc_bnlearn |> set_knowledge(kn) pc_bnlearn(tpc_example) #> Warning: vstructure youth_x4 -> oldage_x6 <- oldage_x5 is not applicable, because one or both arcs are oriented in the opposite direction. #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  -->   youth_x3  #> 3 child_x1  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 child_x2  ---   oldage_x5 #> 5 child_x2  -->   youth_x3  #> 6 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 7 oldage_x5 ---   oldage_x6 #> 8 oldage_x5 -->   youth_x3  #> 9 oldage_x6 -->   youth_x4  #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────   # With all algorithm arguments specified pc_bnlearn <- pc(   engine = "bnlearn",   test = "fisher_z",   alpha = 0.05,   max.sx = 2,   debug = FALSE,   undirected = TRUE )  disco(tpc_example, pc_bnlearn) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  ---   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  ---   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 ---   oldage_x6 #> 5 oldage_x5 ---   youth_x3  #> 6 oldage_x6 ---   youth_x4  #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  #### Using tetrad engine with tier knowledge #### # Requires Tetrad to be installed if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   kn <- knowledge(     tpc_example,     tier(       child ~ tidyselect::starts_with("child"),       youth ~ tidyselect::starts_with("youth"),       oldage ~ tidyselect::starts_with("oldage")     )   )    # Recommended path using disco()   pc_tetrad <- pc(engine = "tetrad", test = "fisher_z", alpha = 0.05)   disco(tpc_example, pc_tetrad, knowledge = kn)    # or using pc_tetrad directly   pc_tetrad <- pc_tetrad |> set_knowledge(kn)   pc_tetrad(tpc_example) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  ---   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # With all algorithm arguments specified if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   pc_tetrad <- pc(     engine = "tetrad",     test = "fisher_z",     alpha = 0.05,     conflict_rule = 2,     depth = 10,     stable_fas = FALSE,     guarantee_cpdag = TRUE   )   disco(tpc_example, pc_tetrad) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  ---   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  ---   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

text: x knowledge object, created using knowledge(). required_col Character(1). Color edges marked "required". Default "blue". forbidden_col Character(1). Color edges marked "forbidden". Default "red". ... Additional arguments passed caugi::plot(), e.g., node_style, edge_style.

title: Plot a Knowledge Object — plot.knowledge
text: Invisibly returns caugi object used plotting. main effect plot.

title: Plot a Knowledge Object — plot.knowledge
text: Required edges drawn blue default (can changed via required_col). Forbidden edges drawn red default (can changed via forbidden_col). B B forbidden, edge <-> drawn. tiered knowledge provided, nodes arranged according tiers. Users can override edge styling (e.g., line width, arrow size) via edge_style argument. override color specific edge, use edge_style$by_edge[[]][[]]$col. Nodes arranged tiers tier information provided knowledge object. nodes missing tier assignments, warning issued plot falls back untiered plotting. function automatically handles edges marked "required" "forbidden" knowledge object. edge styling (line width, arrow size, etc.) can supplied via edge_style. way override edge colors specific edges specify directly edge_style$by_edge[[]][[]]$col.

title: Plot a Knowledge Object — plot.knowledge
code: data(tpc_example)  # Define a knowledge object with tiers kn_tiered <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     old ~ starts_with("old")   ) )  # Simple plot (default column orientation) plot(kn_tiered)   # Plot with row orientation plot(kn_tiered, orientation = "rows")   # Plot with custom node styling, edge width/arrow size and edge colors kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     old ~ starts_with("old")   ),   child_x1 %-->% child_x2, # required edge   youth_x4 %!-->% youth_x3  # forbidden edge ) plot(   kn,   node_style = list(     fill = "lightblue", # Fill color     col = "darkblue", # Border color     lwd = 2, # Border width     padding = 4, # Text padding (mm)     size = 1.2 # Size multiplier   ),   edge_style = list(     lwd = 1.5, # Edge width     arrow_size = 4 # Arrow size (mm)   ),   required_col = "darkgreen",   forbidden_col = "darkorange" )   # Define a knowledge object without tiers kn_untiered <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   child_x1 %-->% c(child_x2, youth_x3),   youth_x4 %!-->% oldage_x5 ) # Plot with default layout plot(kn_untiered)   # With a custom defined layout custom_layout <- data.frame(  name = c("child_x1", "child_x2", "youth_x3", "youth_x4", "oldage_x5", "oldage_x6"),  x = c(0, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4),  y = c(0, 1, 0, -1, 0, 1) ) plot(kn_untiered, layout = custom_layout)

Forbidden edges drawn . tiered knowledge provided, nodes arranged according tiers. edge styling (line width, arrow size, etc.) can supplied via edge_style. override color specific edge, specify edge_style$by_edge[[]][[]]$col. function combines causal graph knowledge object single plotting structure. knowledge contains tiers, nodes laid accordingly; otherwise, default caugi layout used. Edges marked required automatically colored (can overridden per edge using edge_style$by_edge).

title: Plot a Knowledgeable Caugi Object — plot.knowledgeable_caugi
code: data(tpc_example)  # Define tiered knowledge kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     old ~ starts_with("old")   ) )  # Fit a causal discovery model cd_tges <- tges(engine = "causalDisco", score = "tbic") disco_cd_tges <- disco(data = tpc_example, method = cd_tges, knowledge = kn)  # Plot with default column orientation plot(disco_cd_tges)   # Plot with row orientation plot(disco_cd_tges, orientation = "rows")   # Plot with custom node and edge styling plot(   disco_cd_tges,   node_style = list(     fill = "lightblue", # Fill color     col = "darkblue", # Border color     lwd = 2, # Border width     padding = 4, # Text padding (mm)     size = 1.2 # Size multiplier   ),   edge_style = list(     lwd = 1.5, # Edge width     arrow_size = 4, # Arrow size (mm)     col = "darkgreen", # Edge color     fill = "black", # Arrow fill color     lty = "dashed" # Edge line type   ) )   # Plot without tiers data(num_data) kn_untiered <- knowledge(   num_data,   X1 %-->% c(X2, X3),   Z %!-->% Y )  bnlearn_pc <- pc(engine = "bnlearn", test = "fisher_z") res_untiered <- disco(data = num_data, method = bnlearn_pc, knowledge = kn_untiered) plot(res_untiered)   # With a custom defined layout custom_layout <- data.frame(  name = c("X1", "X2", "X3", "Z", "Y"),  x = c(0, 1, 2, 2, 3),  y = c(0, 1, 0.25, -1, 0) ) plot(res_untiered, layout = custom_layout)

title: Merge Knowledge Objects — +.knowledge
code: # Create two knowledge objects kn1 <- knowledge(   tier(     1 ~ V1,     2 ~ V2   ),   V1 %-->% V2 )  kn2 <- knowledge(   tier(3 ~ V3),   V2 %!-->% V3 )  kn_merged <- kn1 + kn2  # Error paths # Merging with conflicting tier information  kn1 <- knowledge(   tier(     1 ~ V1,     2 ~ V2   ) )  kn2 <- knowledge(   tier(3 ~ V2) )  try(kn1 + kn2) #> Error : Tier conflict detected for 1 variable: #> - V2: kn1: 2, kn2: 3  kn2 <- knowledge(   tier(1 ~ V1 + V2) )  try(kn1 + kn2) #> Error : Tier conflict detected for 1 variable: #> - V2: kn1: 2, kn2: 1  # Requried / forbidden violations  kn1 <- knowledge(   V1 %!-->% V2 )  kn2 <- knowledge(   V1 %-->% V2 )  try(kn1 + kn2) #> Error : Edge(s) appear as both forbidden and required: V1 --> V2
