title: Add Required Edges to Knowledge — require_edge
text: updated knowledge object.

title: Add Required Edges to Knowledge — require_edge
code: data(tpc_example)  # create knowledge object using verbs kn1 <- knowledge() |>   add_vars(names(tpc_example)) |>   add_tier(child) |>   add_tier(old, after = child) |>   add_tier(youth, before = old) |>   add_to_tier(child ~ starts_with("child")) |>   add_to_tier(youth ~ starts_with("youth")) |>   add_to_tier(old ~ starts_with("oldage")) |>   require_edge(child_x1 ~ youth_x3) |>   forbid_edge(child_x2 ~ youth_x4) |>   add_exogenous(child_x1) # synonym: add_exo()  # set kn1 to frozen # (meaning you cannot add variables to the knowledge object anymore) # this is to get a true on the identical check kn1$frozen <- TRUE  # create identical knowledge object using DSL kn2 <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     old ~ starts_with("oldage")   ),   child_x1 %-->% youth_x3,   child_x2 %!-->% youth_x4,   exo(child_x1) # synonym: exogenous() )  print(identical(kn1, kn2)) #> [1] TRUE  # cannot require an edge against tier direction try(   kn1 |> require_edge(oldage_x6 ~ child_x1) ) #> Error : Edge(s) violate tier ordering: oldage_x6 --> child_x1  # cannot forbid and require same edge try(   kn1 |> forbid_edge(child_x1 ~ youth_x3) ) #> Error : Edge(s) appear as both forbidden and required: child_x1 --> youth_x3

title: Generate a Bundle of Tier–Variable Formulas — seq_tiers
code: # generate a bundle of tier formulas using a pattern with {i} # here we create: 1 ~ matches("^child_x1$"), 2 ~ matches("^child_x2$") data(tpc_example)  kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(seq_tiers(1:2, matches("^child_x{i}$"))) ) print(kn) #>  #> ── Knowledge object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Tiers ── #>  #>   tier  #>   <chr> #> 1 1     #> 2 2     #> ── Variables ── #>  #>   var       tier  #>   <chr>     <chr> #> 1 child_x1  1     #> 2 child_x2  2     #> 3 oldage_x5 NA    #> 4 oldage_x6 NA    #> 5 youth_x3  NA    #> 6 youth_x4  NA

SP-FCI Algorithm for Causal Discovery — sp_fci

title: SP-FCI Algorithm for Causal Discovery — sp_fci

title: SP-FCI Algorithm for Causal Discovery — sp_fci
code: data(tpc_example)  # Requires Tetrad to be installed if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   # Recommended path using disco()   boss_fci_tetrad <- boss_fci(     engine = "tetrad",     score = "sem_bic",     test = "fisher_z"   )   disco(tpc_example, boss_fci_tetrad)    # or using boss_fci_tetrad directly   boss_fci_tetrad(tpc_example) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  o-o   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  o->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  o-o   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  o->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  #### With tier knowledge #### if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   kn <- knowledge(     tpc_example,     tier(       child ~ tidyselect::starts_with("child"),       youth ~ tidyselect::starts_with("youth"),       oldage ~ tidyselect::starts_with("oldage")     )   )    # Recommended path using disco()   boss_fci_tetrad <- boss_fci(     engine = "tetrad",     score = "sem_bic",     test = "fisher_z"   )   disco(tpc_example, boss_fci_tetrad, knowledge = kn)    # or using boss_fci_tetrad directly   boss_fci_tetrad <- boss_fci_tetrad |> set_knowledge(kn)   boss_fci_tetrad(tpc_example) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  o-o   child_x1  #> 2 child_x2  o->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  o-o   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  o->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────  # With all algorithm arguments specified if (check_tetrad_install()$installed && check_tetrad_install()$java_ok) {   boss_fci_tetrad <- boss_fci(     engine = "tetrad",     score = "poisson_prior",     test = "rank_independence",     depth = 3,     max_disc_path_length = 5,     use_bes = FALSE,     use_heuristic = FALSE,     complete_rule_set_used = FALSE,     guarantee_pag = TRUE   )   disco(tpc_example, boss_fci_tetrad) } #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: UNKNOWN #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from     edge  to        #>   <chr>    <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x2 o-o   oldage_x5 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

title: Specificity — specificity
text: Computes specificity two PDAG caugi objects. converts caugi objects adjacency matrices computes specificity TN/(TN + FP), TN truth negatives FP false positives. TN + FP = 0, 1 returned. supports caugi objects edge types present -->, <-->, --- edge.

title: Specificity — specificity
Specificity — specificity
text: truth caugi object representing truth graph. est caugi object representing estimated graph. type Character string specifying comparison type: "adj": adjacency comparison. "dir": orientation comparison conditional shared adjacencies.

title: Specificity — specificity
text: numeric [0,1].

title: Specificity — specificity
code: cg1 <- caugi::caugi(A %-->% B + C) cg2 <- caugi::caugi(B %-->% A + C) specificity(cg1, cg2, type = "adj") #> [1] 0 specificity(cg1, cg2, type = "dir") #> [1] 0

title: Run the TFCI Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tfci_run

title: Run the TFCI Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tfci_run
code: tfci_run(   data = NULL,   knowledge = NULL,   alpha = 0.05,   test = reg_test,   suff_stat = NULL,   method = "stable.fast",   na_method = "none",   orientation_method = "conservative",   directed_as_undirected = FALSE,   varnames = NULL,   ... )

title: Run the TFCI Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tfci_run
text: data data frame observed variables. Columns variables. using deprecated order argument, variables prefixed period name (see examples). using knowledge, prefixes required. knowledge knowledge object describing tiers/periods optional forbidden/required edges. replaces legacy order interface preferred way supply temporal background knowledge. alpha alpha level used per-test significance threshold conditional independence testing. test conditional independence test. default reg_test uses regression-based information-loss test. Another available option cor_test tests vanishing partial correlations. User-supplied functions may also used; see details required interface. suff_stat sufficient statistic. supplied, passed directly test statistics computed data. structure depends chosen test. method Skeleton construction method, one "stable", "original", "stable.fast" (default). See pcalg::skeleton() details. na_method Handling missing values, one "none" (default; error NA), "cc" (complete-case analysis), "twd" (test-wise deletion). orientation_method Method handling conflicting separating sets orienting edges; must one "standard", "conservative" (default) "maj.rule". See pcalg::pc() details. directed_as_undirected Logical; TRUE, treat directed edges knowledge undirected skeleton learning. due fact pcalg allow directed edges fixedEdges fixedGaps. Default FALSE. varnames Character vector variable names. needed data supplied information passed via suff_stat. ... Additional arguments passed pcalg::skeleton() skeleton construction.

title: Run the TFCI Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tfci_run
text: caugi knowledge (knowledgeable_caugi) object.

title: Run the TFCI Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tfci_run
text: temporal/tiered background information enters several places TFCI algorithm: (1) skeleton construction phase, looking separating sets \(Z\) two variables \(X\) \(Y\), \(Z\) allowed contain variables strictly \(X\) \(Y\) temporal order (specified knowledge tiers). (2) also applies subsequent phase algorithm searches possible D-SEP sets. (3) Prior orientation steps, cross-tier edges get arrowhead placed latest node. , usual FCI orientation rules applied; see pcalg::udag2pag() details.

title: TGES Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tges
code: # Recommended route using disco: kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ starts_with("child"),     youth ~ starts_with("youth"),     old ~ starts_with("old")   ) )  my_tges <- tges(engine = "causalDisco", score = "tbic")  disco(tpc_example, my_tges, knowledge = kn) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Tiers ── #>  #>   tier  #>   <chr> #> 1 child #> 2 youth #> 3 old   #> ── Variables ── #>  #>   var       tier  #>   <chr>     <chr> #> 1 child_x1  child #> 2 child_x2  child #> 3 youth_x3  youth #> 4 youth_x4  youth #> 5 oldage_x5 old   #> 6 oldage_x6 old    # another way to run it  my_tges <- my_tges |>   set_knowledge(kn) my_tges(tpc_example) #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────   # or you can run directly with tges_run()  data(tpc_example)  score_bic <- new(   "TemporalBIC",   data = tpc_example,   nodes = colnames(tpc_example),   knowledge = kn )  res_bic <- tges_run(score_bic) res_bic #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  ---   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 -->   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

title: Simulated Life-Course Data — tpc_example
text: small simulated data example intended showcase TPC algorithm. Note variable name prefixes defines period related ("child", "youth" "oldage").

title: Simulated Life-Course Data — tpc_example
Simulated Life-Course Data — tpc_example
text: data.frame 200 rows 6 variables. child_x1 Structural equation: \(X_1 := \epsilon_1\) \(\epsilon_1 \sim \mathrm{Unif}\{0,1\}\) child_x2 Structural equation: \(X_2 := 2 \cdot X_1 + \epsilon_2\) \(\epsilon_2 \sim N(0,1)\) youth_x3 Structural equation: \(X_3 := \epsilon_3\) \(\epsilon_3 \sim \mathrm{Unif}\{0, 1\}\) youth_x4 Structural equation: \(X_4 := X_2 + \epsilon_4\) \(\epsilon_4  \sim  N(0,1)\) oldage_x5 Structural equation: \(X_5 := X_3^2 + X_3 - 3 \cdot X_2 + \epsilon_5\) \(\epsilon_5 \sim N(0,1)\) oldage_x6 Structural equation: \(X_6 := X_4^3 + X_4^2 + 2 \cdot X_5 + \epsilon_6\) \(\epsilon_6 \sim N(0,1)\)

title: Simulated Life-Course Data — tpc_example

title: Run the TPC Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tpc_run
text: Run tier-aware variant PC algorithm respects background knowledge partial temporal order. Supply temporal order via knowledge object. backward compatibility, may still pass order, interface deprecated removed future release.

title: Run the TPC Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tpc_run
code: tpc_run(   data = NULL,   knowledge = NULL,   alpha = 0.05,   test = reg_test,   suff_stat = NULL,   method = "stable.fast",   na_method = "none",   orientation_method = "conservative",   directed_as_undirected = FALSE,   varnames = NULL,   ... )

title: Run the TPC Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tpc_run
text: data data frame observed variables. Columns variables. using deprecated order argument, variables prefixed period name (see examples). using knowledge, prefixes required. knowledge knowledge object created knowledge(), encoding tier assignments optional forbidden/required edges. preferred way provide temporal background knowledge. alpha alpha level used per-test significance threshold conditional independence testing. test conditional independence test. default reg_test uses regression-based information-loss test. Another available option cor_test tests vanishing partial correlations. User-supplied functions may also used; see details required interface. suff_stat sufficient statistic. supplied, passed directly test statistics computed data. structure depends chosen test. method Skeleton construction method, one "stable", "original", "stable.fast" (default). See pcalg::skeleton() details. na_method Handling missing values, one "none" (default; error NA), "cc" (complete-case analysis), "twd" (test-wise deletion). orientation_method Conflict-handling method orienting edges. Currently conservative method available. directed_as_undirected Logical; TRUE, treat directed edges knowledge undirected skeleton learning. due fact pcalg allow directed edges fixedEdges fixedGaps. Default FALSE. varnames Character vector variable names. needed data supplied information passed via suff_stat. ... Additional arguments passed pcalg::skeleton() skeleton construction.

title: Run the TPC Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tpc_run
text: caugi knowledge (knowledgeable_caugi) object.

title: Run the TPC Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tpc_run
text: independence test implemented pcalg may used; see pcalg::pc(). na_method = "twd", test-wise deletion performed: cor_test, pairwise correlation uses complete cases; reg_test, conditional test performs deletion. supply user-defined test, must also provide suff_stat. Temporal tiered knowledge enters two places: skeleton estimation, candidate conditioning sets pruned contain variables strictly endpoints; orientation, cross-tier edge restricted point forward time. order argument deprecated. provided, converted knowledge object assigning variables tiers using tidyselect::starts_with() prefix.

title: Run the TPC Algorithm for Causal Discovery — tpc_run
code: # Load data data(tpc_example)  # Build knowledge kn <- knowledge(   tpc_example,   tier(     child ~ tidyselect::starts_with("child"),     youth ~ tidyselect::starts_with("youth"),     old ~ tidyselect::starts_with("old")   ) )  # Recommended route using disco my_tpc <- tpc(engine = "causalDisco", test = "fisher_z", alpha = 0.05)  disco(tpc_example, my_tpc, knowledge = kn) #>  #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  -->   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 ---   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Tiers ── #>  #>   tier  #>   <chr> #> 1 child #> 2 youth #> 3 old   #> ── Variables ── #>  #>   var       tier  #>   <chr>     <chr> #> 1 child_x1  child #> 2 child_x2  child #> 3 youth_x3  youth #> 4 youth_x4  youth #> 5 oldage_x5 old   #> 6 oldage_x6 old    # or using my_tpc directly  my_tpc <- my_tpc |> set_knowledge(kn) my_tpc(tpc_example) #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  -->   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 ---   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Tiers ── #>  #>   tier  #>   <chr> #> 1 child #> 2 youth #> 3 old   #> ── Variables ── #>  #>   var       tier  #>   <chr>     <chr> #> 1 child_x1  child #> 2 child_x2  child #> 3 youth_x3  youth #> 4 youth_x4  youth #> 5 oldage_x5 old   #> 6 oldage_x6 old    # Using tpc_run() directly  tpc_run(tpc_example, knowledge = kn, alpha = 0.01) #> ── caugi graph ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Graph class: PDAG #>  #> ── Edges ── #>  #>   from      edge  to        #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>     #> 1 child_x1  -->   child_x2  #> 2 child_x2  -->   oldage_x5 #> 3 child_x2  -->   youth_x4  #> 4 oldage_x5 ---   oldage_x6 #> 5 youth_x3  -->   oldage_x5 #> 6 youth_x4  -->   oldage_x6 #> ── Nodes ── #>  #>   name      #>   <chr>     #> 1 child_x2  #> 2 child_x1  #> 3 youth_x4  #> 4 youth_x3  #> 5 oldage_x6 #> 6 oldage_x5 #> ── Knowledge object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Tiers ── #>  #>   tier  #>   <chr> #> 1 child #> 2 youth #> 3 old   #> ── Variables ── #>  #>   var       tier  #>   <chr>     <chr> #> 1 child_x1  child #> 2 child_x2  child #> 3 youth_x3  youth #> 4 youth_x4  youth #> 5 oldage_x5 old   #> 6 oldage_x6 old

title: Unfreeze a Knowledge Object. — unfreeze
code: # unfreeze allows adding variables beyond the original data frame columns data(tpc_example)  kn <- knowledge(tpc_example)  # this would error while frozen try(add_vars(kn, "new_var")) #> Error : Unknown variable(s): [new_var] #> They are not present in the data frame provided to this knowledge object.  # unfreeze and add the new variable successfully kn <- unfreeze(kn) kn <- add_vars(kn, "new_var")  print(kn) #>  #> ── Knowledge object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Variables ── #>  #>   var       tier  #>   <chr>     <chr> #> 1 child_x1  NA    #> 2 child_x2  NA    #> 3 oldage_x5 NA    #> 4 oldage_x6 NA    #> 5 youth_x3  NA    #> 6 youth_x4  NA    #> 7 new_var   NA

title: Add Tetrad Algorithms
text: ccd (test-based) Produces cyclic PAG, edge semantics differ standard PAGs. Tetrad says background knowledge, seems required knowledge allowed? CStaR (score + test) Unclear run algorithm Tetrad (nonstandard workflow). accept background knowledge. DAGMA (neither score- test-based) accept background knowledge. Direct-LiNGAM (score-based) accept background knowledge. ica_lingam (neither score- test-based) accept background knowledge. ica_lingd (neither score- test-based) return output run Tetrad. accept background knowledge. FASK (score-based) Returns cyclic directed graph, DAG/… ges_mb (score-based) Requires explicit specification Markov blanket. restricted_boss (score-based) Requires user specify target names.

title: Add Tetrad Algorithms
text: DM-PC (test-based) Searches intermediate latent variables. Example output may include structures like v → L1 → x non_linear.csv. FAS (test-based) Adjacency (skeleton) search ; corresponds first phase PC. FASK-PW (neither score- test-based) Requires data undirected graph input. Orients edges supplied graph. Factor Analysis (neither score- test-based) Currently functional Tetrad undocumented. GIN (test-based) accept background knowledge. ImaGES (score-based) Accepts multiple datasets assumption shared graph structure. Potentially useful multiple imputation settings. ImaGES-BOSS (score-based) Accepts multiple datasets assumption shared graph structure. Potentially useful multiple imputation settings. IOD (test-based) Running Tetrad fails :illegal state: continued fraction diverged NaN value inf. R3 (score/test separation) Requires data undirected graph input. Orients edges supplied graph. PC-MB (test-based) Requires explicit specification Markov blanket. rfci (test-based) Returns RFCI-PAG, standard PAG. Already implemented pcalg. dPAG-sampling-rfci (neither score- test-based) Returns RFCI-PAG, standard PAG (assume)? Discrete datasets . RSkew (neither score- test-based) Requires data undirected graph input. Orients edges supplied graph. Skew (score/test separation) Requires data undirected graph input. Orients edges supplied graph.

title: causalDisco 0.9.5
text: CRAN release: 2026-01-20 Fixed warnings notes R CMD check regarding documentation.

title: causalDisco 0.9.3
text: Changed structure tpdag tskeleton objects include tamat objects rather amat order slots. major change, backwards compatible! tpc now passes … argument skeleton() function call Added functionality tpc handle missing information using built-tests. Three options now available: complete case analysis, test wise deletion, handling (.e., error thrown NAs, default backwards compatible).
